Articles.Content:
Pretty simple problem that doesn't have an obvious answer to me any way. How do i delete maneuver nodes BEFORE I pass them.

Sure once the node is used you click and there is the red "X" but i've pretty well clutter my flight plan with faulty nodes and would like to clear them before i get there.

However the red "x" do normaly get rid of them doesn't show until after you pass it and pressing "delete" as would seem logical takes you back to stage view.

Edited May 20, 2013 by aleis
Right click them? The red X should appear.

I believe (but can't recall for certain) that right-clicking a node you haven't reached yet gives you that red 'X' (I know there's some way to get that, anyway, and I think that's it).

You can also click-and-drag it off of your orbital path and it'll disappear. This has actually frustrated more often than helped me, as it usually happens when I'm playing with large variations in when to make a maneuver, rather than trying to delete it!
Hmm must have hit a bug it really didn't want me to be able to do that. Must have decided to rebel after I made it calculate all those vectors and not use them.

First click the Node, then right click the white circle (the one you would use to move).

it should work
